description: Pisot sequence E(4,27): a(n) = floor(a(n-1)^2/a(n-2)+1/2) for n>1, a(0)=4, a(1)=27.
links: D. W. Boyd, Some integer sequences related to the Pisot sequences, Acta Arithmetica, 34 (1979), 295-305
D. W. Boyd, Linear recurrence relations for some generalized Pisot sequences, Advances in Number Theory ( Kingston ON, 1991) 333-340, Oxford Sci. Publ., Oxford Univ. Press, New York, 1993.
mathematica: RecurrenceTable[{a[0] == 4, a[1] == 27, a[n] == Floor[a[n - 1]^2/a[n - 2] + 1/2]}, a, {n, 0, 25}] (* _Bruno Berselli_, Sep 03 2013 *)
prog: (MAGMA) Exy:=[4,27]; [n le 2 select Exy[n] else Floor(Self(n-1)^2/Self(n-2)+1/2): n in [1..25]]; // _Bruno Berselli_, Sep 03 2013
author: _Simon Plouffe_
